fields.name: scrapedDatasets
fields.description: Query for scraped datasets (admin only)

args.name: filters

fields.description: Retrieve an experiment run by its id

args.description: The path of the project to raise the issue on, in the format @namespace/path

args.name: issueId
args.description: The unique identifier of the issue

fields.name: keywords
fields.description: Return all keywords in use across the Index

fields.name: licenses
fields.description:
License which may be used to publish items to the Index under.

If no suitable license is listed, publishers are advised to select Copyright
(All Rights Reserved) and then note their specific usage conditions in the
listing's descriptions.

fields.description: Retrieve a project merge request

args.name: projectPath
args.description: The path of the project to raise the merge request on, in the format @namespace/path

args.name: mergeRequestId

fields.name: org

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the organization

args.name: name
args.description: The organization's name (case-insensitive, first partial match returned)

args.name: shortname
args.description: The organization's shortname (unique string identifier in HASH)

fields.description: Retrieve data on all organizations, or those with names containing a specific string

args.name: name
args.description: Optional - search organizations by name (case-insensitive, all partial matches returned)

fields.description: Return a PolyModel by its slug

fields.description: Return all PolyModels available via the HASH API

fields.name: project
fields.description: Retrieve a project by its path

args.name: projectPath
args.description: The full path of the project, including its namespace and path, in the format @namespace/path

args.name: ref
args.description:
Retrieve the project at a given tag, branch, or commit. Defaults to the
latest tag if it exists, or main if there are no releases.

args.name: oldId
args.description: Retrieve a project by its old database id, to service legacy URLs

args.name: oldType
args.description: Whether the oldId belonged to an Index listing or a simulation

args.name: accessCode
args.description: Access token to use if project is private.

fields.name: release
fields.description: Retrieve a release of a particular project

args.name: projectPath
args.description: The full path of the project, including its namespace and path, in the format @namespace/path

args.name: tag
args.description: The release tag/version to retrieve. Defaults to the latest release if none specified

args.name: files
args.description: Specify only a subset of released files to retrieve. Otherwise, all files exported from the release are provided

fields.name: specialProjects
fields.description:
"
Query for special types of projects

fields.name: searchProjects
fields.description: Search for projects matching the filters specified.

args.name: query
args.description:
Text to search for in the project's description or keywords. Where this is
provided, results will be sorted by a relevance score which weights matches
in keywords higher than in description.

Enclose phrases in "escaped quotes" for exact phrase matches, and exclude
results containing specific words by -prefixing -them -with -a -minus.

args.name: subjects
args.description: Limit the results of a search to listings covering a specific subject or subjects.

args.name: types
args.description: The types of items being searched for

args.name: perPage
args.description: The number of results to return (default 10).

args.name: page
args.description: The page of results to return (default 1).

args.name: sort
args.description: How the results should be sorted

args.name: language
args.description: For behavior projects only, the programming language of the behavior(s)

args.name: temporalCoverage
args.description: For datasets only, the time period covered by the dataset(s)

args.name: dataFrequency
args.description: For datasets only, the frequency of data points within the dataset(s)

args.name: spatialCoverage
args.description: For datasets only, the geographical area covered by the dataset(s)

args.name: releasedOnly
args.description: Only return projects with at least one release

fields.name: roles
fields.description: Return all site-wide roles in the system

fields.name: subjects
fields.description: Retrieve all available subject types in the system

args.name: onlyPopulated
args.description:
Only return subjects which have Index listings associated with them, for
either all listings, or a given type. Omit to return all categories,
including ones which are not assigned to any listing.

fields.name: subject
fields.description: Retrieve a subject.

args.name: name
args.description: The subject's name

args.name: namespace
args.description: If omitted, 'schema' is used

args.name: version
args.description: If omitted, the latest is returned

fields.name: properties
fields.description: Retrieve all available properties in the system

fields.name: property
fields.description: Retrieve a property

args.name: name
args.description: The property's name

args.name: namespace
args.description: If omitted, 'schema' is used

args.name: version
args.description: If omitted, the latest is returned

fields.name: me
fields.description: Information on the user making the request

fields.name: users
fields.description: Retrieve all users by page, with optional filtering

fields.name: user
fields.description: Retrieve the details of a specific user by their ID, email address, or shortname

fields.name: userOrOrg
fields.description: Retrieve a user or organization by their shortname or id

fields.name: availableIntegrations
fields.description:
Fetch available integrations, either for this user,
or for this user that are also authorized for the given projectId.

args.name: types
args.description: A list of integration types to retrieve. Will retrieve all available integrations if no type specified.

args.name: hFlowOnly
args.description: Filter integration types to those valid as hFlow sources only

args.name: namespaceId
args.description: Limit the query to integrations belonging to this namespace.

args.name: projectId
args.description:
The project ID to query for authorizations for.
If not given, returns all integrations of these types that the user has access to.
If given, only returns integrations that the user has access to that are authorized for this project.

fields.name: integration
fields.description: Fetch full integration information -- _WILL_ include the secret of the credential itself if the user is allowed access.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the integration to retrieve.

fields.name: integrations
fields.description: Internal-only endpoint for fetching integrations.

args.name: ids
args.description: The ID of the integration to retrieve.

fields.name: resolveIntegrations
fields.description:
Retrieves the set of integrations to be used for a given user and project.
Errors out if the user has not set up integrations properly for the project.

args.name: projectId
args.description: The ID of the project to resolve integrations for.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

Consists of _exactly one_ source configuration (host, port, database, etc) and _exactly one_ credential.
Can be owned by either a user or an organization.
If owned by an organization, only an admin can modify it, but any member of the organization can access it.

  date: Date!
  asName: String!
}
To be used for finding the authorized integration the user is currently using for simulation runs.

recently is the one the user is using. Hit the permitIntegration endpoint to update a

types.name: BigQuery
types.description: Configuration information for Google BigQuery.

fields.name: url
fields.description:
The base URL to query against. Example: https://bigquery.googleapis.com/bigquery/v1/projects/some-project-id/queries
If not specified, will be literally https://bigquery.googleapis.com/bigquery/v1/projects/$projectId/queries.

fields.name: projectId
fields.description: The ID of the _Google Cloud_ project (no relation to HASH project IDs).

fields.name: datasetId
fields.description: The ID of the _Google Cloud_ dataset that will be queried.

fields.name: query
fields.description:
Optional. If not specified here, must be specified in the transformation that uses it.
Some valid SQL statement to use when querying the dataset. 
Should be in a format that runs successfully in Google's query editor. Example:
"#standardSQL
SELECT
  growth.country_name,
  growth.net_migration,
 
CAST(area.country_area AS INT64) AS country_area
FROM (
  SELECT
   
country_name,
    net_migration,
    country_code
  FROM
   
`bigquery-public-data.census_bureau_international.birth_death_growth_rates`
 
WHERE
    year = 2020) growth
INNER JOIN (
  SELECT
    country_area,
   
country_code
  FROM
   
`bigquery-public-data.census_bureau_international.country_names_area`)
area
ON
  growth.country_code = area.country_code
ORDER BY
  net_migration DESC",

fields.name: useLegacySql
fields.description:
Optional. If not specified here, must be specified in the transformation that uses it.
Whether the query is using Legacy SQL features. Almost invariably false, and the user will likely know if it isn't.

fields.name: createExperimentRun
fields.description:
Creates an ExperimentRun with a name - looks up the experiment name from the repo's experiments.json, and then:
  (1) for each necessary run in the experiment, applies the changed properties to the
 Simulation repository in a new commit
  (2) constructs an s3 folder to save the output of the SimulationRun to.
    format: [userId]/[experimentRunId]/[simulationRunId]

Each SimulationRun has an s3Key indicating where its data is/should be saved.

s3 Bucket: hash-experiments

A single SimulationRun experiment using an exact copy of the referenced
simulation can be created by passing singleRun: true

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the experiment to be run (as defined in the simulation's experiments.json)

args.name: projectPath
args.description: The path to the simulation project to run this experiment on.

args.name: ref
args.description:
A commit, tag or branch to run the experiment at. Defaults to 'main'. The
available experiment definitions will be determined by the contents of
experiments.json at this reference

args.name: packageName
args.description: The experiment package to run. Defaults to 'simple'

args.name: createRuns
args.description:
[DEPRECATED - IGNORED] Whether or not to immediately create records for
SimulationRuns under this experiment. If false, createSimulationRun must be
called for each run, to create a record of each run.

args.name: singleRun
args.description: [DEPRECATED] DO NOT USE

args.name: id
args.description: The id of the ExperimentRun to associate the SimulationRun with

args.name: propertyValues
args.description: The property values in globals.json this experiment will vary

fields.name: reportComputeUsage
fields.description:
Report cloud compute usage for an ExperimentRun. Multiple reports may be made
to update the usage count, until the report is finalised

args.name: id
args.description: The id of the ExperimentRun to report usage for

args.name: usage
args.description: The compute seconds this ExperimentRun has used so far (cumulative)

args.name: finalise
args.description: Whether to finalise the usage report for this ExperimentRun

fields.name: updateExperimentRun
fields.description: Provide a name for a experiment run

args.name: id
args.description: The id of the ExperimentRun

fields.name: updateSimulationRun
fields.description: Provide a name or the outcome for a simulation run

args.name: id
args.description: The id of the SimulationRun

args.name: name
args.description: A friendly name for the run

args.name: metricOutcome
args.description: The outcome of the metric of interest

fields.name: deleteExperimentRun
fields.description:
Deletes an experiment run and each simulation run within it, including the
stored output and the immutable simulation variants used in the experiment.
Does not delete the original simulation that the experiment was called from.

fields.name: deleteSimulationRun
fields.description:
Deletes a simulation run, including the stored output and the immutable
simulation variant used to produce the run. Does not delete the original
simulatiton the experiment was based on, nor other simulation runs in the same
experiment. Returns the updated ExperimentRun without the deleted SimulationRun.

the repo to be exported as part of the release

types.name: BigQueryCreation
types.description: BigQuery source creation information.

inputFields.name: url
inputFields.description:
The base URL to query against. Example: https://bigquery.googleapis.com/bigquery/v1/projects/some-project-id/queries
If not specified, will be literally https://bigquery.googleapis.com/bigquery/v1/projects/$projectId/queries.

inputFields.name: projectId
inputFields.description: The ID of the _Google Cloud_ project (no relation to HASH project IDs).

inputFields.name: datasetId
inputFields.description: The ID of the _Google Cloud_ dataset that will be queried.

inputFields.name: query
inputFields.description:
Optional. If not specified here, must be specified in the transformation that uses it.
Some valid SQL statement to use when querying the dataset. 
Should be in a format that runs successfully in Google's query editor. Example:
"#standardSQL
SELECT
  growth.country_name,
  growth.net_migration,
 
CAST(area.country_area AS INT64) AS country_area
FROM (
  SELECT
   
country_name,
    net_migration,
    country_code
  FROM
   
`bigquery-public-data.census_bureau_international.birth_death_growth_rates`
 
WHERE
    year = 2020) growth
INNER JOIN (
  SELECT
    country_area,
   
country_code
  FROM
   
`bigquery-public-data.census_bureau_international.country_names_area`)
area
ON
  growth.country_code = area.country_code
ORDER BY
  net_migration DESC",

inputFields.name: useLegacySql
inputFields.description:
Optional. If not specified here, must be specified in the transformation that uses it.
Whether the query is using Legacy SQL features. Almost invariably false, and the user will likely know if it isn't.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: AvailableIntegrations
types.description:
A list of all integrations available to a user,
OR
A list of all integrations authorized for a project for a given user
  IF it is part of a Project response, or a projectId was given in the request.

types.name: IntegrateInput
types.description:
NOT IMPLEMENTED YET.
    TODO Requires CRUD operations on individual sources and credentials first.
    Purpose is to enable sources without credentials and vice versa to be added at the organization level,
    and for sources to be tied directly to projects without credentials.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax (as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).
